executeSupply(DataTypes.ReserveData stor.details: Emits the `Supply()` event.In the first supply action, `ReserveUsedAsCollateralEnabled()` is emitted, if the asset can be enabled as collateral.

params.params: The additional parameters needed to execute the supply function
params.totalSupplies: The total supplies of the reserve

executeUseReserveAsCollateral(mapping(ad.details: Emits the `ReserveUsedAsCollateralEnabled()` event if the asset can be activated as collateral.In case the asset is being deactivated as collateral, `ReserveUsedAsCollateralDisabled()` is emitted.

params.reservesData: The state of all the reserves
params.reservesList: The addresses of all the active reserves
params.useAsCollateral: True if the user wants to set the asset as collateral, false otherwise
params.userConfig: The users configuration mapping that track the supplied/borrowed assets

executeWithdraw(mapping(address => DataT.details: Emits the `Withdraw()` event.If the user withdraws everything, `ReserveUsedAsCollateralDisabled()` is emitted.

params.params: The additional parameters needed to execute the withdraw function
params.reservesData: The state of all the reserves
params.reservesList: The addresses of all the active reserves
params.userConfig: The user configuration mapping that tracks the supplied/borrowed assets

executeSupply(DataTypes.ReserveData stor.notice: Implements the supply feature. Through `supply()`, users supply assets to the ZeroLend protocol.

executeUseReserveAsCollateral(mapping(ad.notice: Executes the 'set as collateral' feature. A user can choose to activate or deactivate an asset as collateral at any point in time. Deactivating an asset as collateral is subjected to the usual health factor checks to ensure collateralization.

executeWithdraw(mapping(address => DataT.notice: Implements the withdraw feature. Through `withdraw()`, users redeem their aTokens for the underlying asset previously supplied in the ZeroLend protocol.

userdoc.notice: Implements the base logic for supply/withdraw
